doc.field: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 17
Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 17
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."

3. "Lambda Update": Kevin Cathcart, Executive Director of the Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund, introduces Lou Maletta's interview with Jennifer Pizer, Managing Attorney for the Western Regional Office of Lambda, regarding the freedom to marry and anti-gay marriage legislation pending in many US states.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
4. Footage of Lee Sharmat at Night of 1000 Gowns.
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
5. Footage of Lee Sharmat at Legacy Foundation Benefit.
6. Footage of David Petersen Award Presentation. Includes Lou Maletta interviewing Karen [Teemar], Director of Education for Body Postive.
7. Interview: Peggy Shaw, actor, discusses the play "The Slow Drag", in which she plays a man named Johnny Christmas.
